website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a chainsaw that won't empty your pockets, this smaller corded model gives provides plenty of bite, along with a two-year warranty.
pros: Easy to assemble and to adjust chain
Can remove the kickback bar to make it more compact before storing
Less noise and pollution than a gas chainsaw, and will cut continuously for a longer period of time
Oil keeps chain lubricated when necessary
cons: Chain won’t work if put on in wrong direction
Need to use a heavy-duty extension cord if working beyond the saw's plugged-in distance

customer_reviews.title: Does well on logs to 6"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I do have a fair amount of wood that <=6" in diameter and my Husqvarna 460 is a little overkill. Check the bar oil, plug in 15A extension cord, and away we go. Chain stops rotating pretty quickly. Balance in OK, considering I have that heavy duty extension cord on it. Only ding off 5 stars is the chain does not bite from time-to-time. I'd guess the depth gauges / guides need to be ground down a little and perhaps that's by design to prevent overbite. Do check the chain tension frequently in the beginning, as with all new chains, it will stretch, and any unevenness on the bar will grind down, resulting in slop.
customer_reviews.author: Erik K.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a gas saw, but much quieter
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw will cut anything a gas saw can cut, and you are guaranteed it will start every time. Just make sure you never bog down the motor trying to cut faster. It cuts plenty fast, with hardly any pressure, and high RPMs are needed to keep the motor cool. After a recent storm, a thick 14 inch diameter limb from a pine tree came crashing down. No problem at all. This saw cut through it like butter. I highly recommend this saw. I also have the B+D 20V Max Battery chain saw which has a 10 inch bar. What can you cut with that? You would be astonished! Both are great performers.
customer_reviews.author: AceFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: Have cut many a log down to splitting size with this chainsaw. Its simplicity and ease of use trumps any horsepower or portability gains from a gas-powered saw. I chose this over a different brand-name saw because one reviewer below said this was "too heavy". I would associate weight with build quality for things like chainsaws, and this is no exception. Well-built, easy to use, and plenty of power for cutting down trees and logs near the house. Take a generator with you and you can cut in the woods all day while your buddies are filling up with gas and mathematically calculating fuel/oil ratios.
customer_reviews.author: MBone

customer_reviews.title: Good chain saw for around the house use, excellent design for adjusting chain tension quickly with no tools and your gloves on!
customer_reviews.text: A windstorm brought down an 24" Ponderosa pine outside my cabin. A good chance to try out my new chainsaw. Assembly was quick and easy, filled with oil, and went to work. With a brand new sharp chain, I was able to cut rounds quite easily for next year's firewood! Well balanced, an easily handled weight, good power. As with any new chain, it required frequent retightening as it stretched. That is where I discovered the neatest design feature -- the chain can be adjusted in seconds without any tools and without taking your gloves off! Simply loosen that big screw, turn a large adjusting wheel, and then tighten the screw.
customer_reviews.author: bill peters

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SMALL TRIMMING JOBS, WAY CHEAPER THAN PAYING A LANDSCAPER
customer_reviews.text: Great for light duty trimming, without the mess of mixing oil and gas and adjusting carbeurators. I was quoted $600 for a project to trim my trees by a local tree-trimming service. No way. I bought this thing for less than $100, including shipping. It worked great. I did the job myself in an hour. AND I get to keep the saw in case I ever need it again. This was a no-brainer...
customer_reviews.author: Holy Roller

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: First time using an electric chainsaw (have used gas saws for years). Was looking for something relatively inexpensive for light duty use. Casing holding the chain oil leaks oil from seams. Did not notice the leak until oil dripped all over my work bench. No indication this was a used or refurbished item, and if new, the quality control is abhorrent. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE SAW!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little chain saw. Plenty of strength for a corded electric. Had to be put it together, but was guided through it. Pretty simple... no tools necessary. Great price. I used it and it was a breeze to operate and handled what I need to do. .
customer_reviews.author: cyn n vin

customer_reviews.title: A nice brake from the Large Saws.
customer_reviews.text: very very nice little elect. chin saw. I have cut 3 cords of pine and ash tree limb wood up to 10 in" with no problem. I really like the ease of chain Adjustment and take down. Using my Generator makes it easy to go to cutting site. I also have a 029 still and a 460, after time a time you get worn out, so its nice to use a lite saw. I have never over heated it, I don't push hard on it.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about using a chainsaw to cut down several overgrown ewe bushes. I did one using manual tools and it took me two days. After that, I took a chance and bought the smallest one I could find. I had some trouble adjusting the chain but after a couple of tries it worked beautifully. I removed 3 more bushes in 9 hours. The manual rightly stresses safety. It could your arm off in half a second. You must follow safety guidelines.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good, but leaks bar oil
customer_reviews.text: If you don't do a lot of cutting (ie suburbs), this is a great product. Cuts a bit slower than a gas powered chain saw, but still gets the job done. It's very quiet - my wife sitting in the house couldn't even heard me outside with it. The only reason for 3 stars is that it slow-leaks the bar oil whether the reservoir is full or just barely has any in it. Not returning it because it still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Kram

customer_reviews.title: All oil leaked out before first use
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions to the T to assemble the unit and fill it with oil, then set it down on my driveway while getting ready to use it for the first time. When I picked it up 5 minutes later, the oil had leaked out leaving a nice stain on my driveway (who's going to clean that?). I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C.

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good chainsaw for the price, I feel like I got my moneys worth finishing up my big yard project. Largest diameter I sawed through was 6-7 inches, it was slow but did fine. Sawing down a large bush with many small twigs/branches ripped the chain off several times. I love that it is electric so I don't have to worry about gas/oil mixtures. Goes through oil quickly, so make sure you buy some extra.
customer_reviews.author: nalexis13

customer_reviews.title: Great electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Liked the simple chain tightening system. Liked the ease of use. Liked the very efficient way it cut up an 8" diameter tree that had fallen over my daughter's driveway. It has it's limitations in power....but not much! Seems to be a good product and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dshomette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, handy, and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: A handy little tool for home gardening, this is great for occasionally trimming small limbs. It is not, though, practical for heavy use or tree removal.
customer_reviews.author: John Hazard Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Better have patience
customer_reviews.text: The plastic adjuster is difficult to use = chain comes off easily = chain damage. By the way B&D replacement chains are one of the most expensive. Check replacement part cost before you buy brand. Yes I know its only an electric application.
customer_reviews.author: Viking55

customer_reviews.title: Works great, unexpectedly powerful
customer_reviews.text: I used it to cut through 8" white oak logs and this thing had no problems at all. Seemed to me to be similar power to the gas chainsaws I used to use. The automatic oilier and tool-less chain tension adjustment is great. The only way this could be better is if it were battery operated with the same amount of power.
customer_reviews.author: T. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised if not better! I cut down a tree and then cut it up in less than an hour...just like butter! It was very easy to put together and just as easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O

customer_reviews.title: be careful with the cable
customer_reviews.text: it works well and is very affordable. It is a serious tool however and one has to be careful. The most tricky part for me so far is to make sure that the cable is not in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful chainsaws..cut down a tree in my back yard easily..great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Prime member

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use. Follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews and comparing with other similar chainsaws i settled on this one and i already have an electric black n decker hedge trimmer so i figured i would try the same brand. In my picture you can see the size of tree and trunk i cut up it did a good job. I had no trouble with the chain hopping off or tension on the chain coming undone. Its a smooth operator and i have another tree to cut down (same size) and have full confidence in the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos ayala

customer_reviews.title: The product doesn't cut through wood. More oil comes ...
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn't cut through wood. More oil comes out than sawdust from cutting wood. I will never buy this product again and would advise no one else to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Elien

customer_reviews.title: works great for medium size jobs
customer_reviews.text: works great for medium size jobs, where you need to do it quick and not have to get the gas/oil mix and the larger chain saw going. Have it done with the smaller electric before the gas chain saw is ready.
customer_reviews.author: JohnApple

customer_reviews.title: No more heavy noisy chain saws for me.
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait all these years to buy an electric. Light, quiet, cuts great, a easy to take part and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this was so easy to use and did a tremendous job cutting through dead tree limbs so we could clean up our yard.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: I can still use this easily to trim the thick-branch bushes around our home
customer_reviews.text: Even though it is "slightly heavy" for me (as a woman), I can still use this easily to trim the thick-branch bushes around our home! It is exactly as described!
customer_reviews.author: Mary P Ward

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Beware it isn't clear that you need oil to run thIs thing! I recommend getting it before or with the item. Also the chain on this has more slack that the directions say it should. We've taken it apart several times to see what the problem is. It works but we stick with very small projects for fear of injury.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Harris

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of sawing with this bad boy this weekend. For small branches and thin trees, this thing eats right through them. Oil seems to be coming out nicely and keeping the chain and guard lubricated. I'll update if things change, but so far, I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R. Higdon

customer_reviews.title: This chain saw is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is a beast. Nobody believes it cut down a tree this big but it did.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM

customer_reviews.title: Good for light jobs
customer_reviews.text: Used it to trim a bunch of trees in my yard. None of the branches were huge but it zipped right through them. Chain is really easy to adjust once you figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: wej

customer_reviews.title: Works but leaks bar oil
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but make sure you sit it on a plastic bag with some newspaper over it since all the bar oil will run out of the lubrication port in a few days making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect timing for having to cut up a tree
customer_reviews.text: Perfect timing for having to cut up a tree. California happens to be in the middle of a bunch of wildfires in thankfully I had just made this purchase and it has oil and it's ready to go. Don't forget to get chainsaw oil
customer_reviews.author: Sus

customer_reviews.title: First one leaked oil all over my garage, worked ...
customer_reviews.text: First one leaked oil all over my garage, worked well though (when it had oil in it) They sent me a replacement, havent put oil in that one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Knell

customer_reviews.title: Impressed for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Saw worked better than expected. Used to remove numerous overgrown shrubs and it cut them like butter. Yes there is a cord, but no more mixing gas and smelling smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Aviator

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: bar comes loose and chain comes off even when tightened up. Have to use channel lock pliers to tighten the bar to chassis, but even with wrenching it down tight, chain still comes off.
customer_reviews.author: chuck knight

customer_reviews.title: Nice chainsaw for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this chainsaw. It has more than enough power for my needs. I took down several trees that were approximately 6-8 inches in diameter with ease and the chain is very sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff! However chain keeps loosening up
customer_reviews.text: Need to re-tighten after a few cuts. Has a pretty good kick to it. So be careful and use pruning shears wherever you can. Don't try to cut small branches or you get a kick.
customer_reviews.author: Karisma

customer_reviews.title: Damaged package
customer_reviews.text: Would have given a 1 star had it not worked. The package came in the original box, but it was damaged. Some metal parts were bent. The plastic parts were scratched. Took about 10 minutes to assemble and luckily it worked. Didn't feel like returning the item because I needed it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Giang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like a champ. Used it after a major storm for big branch cleanup. Works and zips right through those 3-4" branches very easily.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: It does the job I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: The saw works well so far. It does a good job cutting moderately sized limbs. I like the fact that an electric saw starte instantly and turns off completely when the trigger is released, where a gas saw may or may not start and remains in idle when the trigger is released. The test will be how long it lasts, but after a few years I could but a new one for the cost of service for a gas saw. I do not think it uses excessive amounts of oil, and I have not had the oil leakage problem other reviewers spoke about.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Good saw.
customer_reviews.text: This electric saw is not as powerful as a gasoline powered saw but works fine. I think it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Warrior1

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great tool for me
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great tool for me. Takes a little getting used to the adjustments, and you must keep it lubed. I've gone through a number of mature crepe myrtles and large oak limbs.
customer_reviews.author: JustsomeReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw with one caveat in our case...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this saw for trimming a lot of the smaller trees around our house. It works beautifully and the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the chain is always needing tightening. In fact it's the first saw we've had that came off the track several times.
customer_reviews.author: WSF

customer_reviews.title: Great for price and beginners
customer_reviews.text: My first chainsaw so I was bit weary. Works as advertised a great beginner tool
customer_reviews.author: georges rosemond

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It work well, but have a lot of trouble with the chain loosing.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just right size for me and does the job. Does drink a lot of oil .
customer_reviews.author: H.S.R

customer_reviews.title: Cuts trees and uses oil equally effectively...
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap and cuts wood/trees pretty well. The bad news is that it uses oil really quickly.
customer_reviews.author: BlueC

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! No more yanking ropes til my arms want to fall off. Lightweight, powerful. It does use a lot of bar oil so be prepared for that.
customer_reviews.author: His Little Angel

customer_reviews.title: large bushes and it works amazing. I don't think anything can beat it for ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit uncertain because it's a black and decker and I have never purchased the brand before. I use it about every 2 weeks on my landscaping for palm trees, large bushes and it works amazing. I don't think anything can beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: George Lara-Maya

customer_reviews.title: It was good for a while, then started leaking oil badly from reservoir.
customer_reviews.text: It was good for a while, then started leaking oil badly from reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: has performed well so far,
customer_reviews.text: has performed well so far, timely purchase as we just went through hurricane irma and have trees and branches to clear
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Adjust the chain's tightness without tools!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful electric saw. So great to be able to adjust the chain's tightness without tools. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great electric chain saw for home use. Powerful and cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: K4HOC

customer_reviews.title: Easy for a woman to use.
customer_reviews.text: Could have used a bigger manual. Would have liked a sample of oil necessary for chain saao
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very well
customer_reviews.text: love it, I have a 6 gas chain saws, when I just want to trim some branches at the house this works awesome
customer_reviews.author: Baja Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw. Very good todque, lightweight and cut foot thick logs easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto P. Torres Jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice power, came with a sharp chain but no ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice power ,came with a sharp chain but no chain oil , I only cut the extension cord once but did. Manage to cut up two 14 inch maples in an afternoon
customer_reviews.author: david hill

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cousin and he really likes it. He has a back yard fire pit, and this sure comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Luv this when close to outlet yeah so I don't have to start the gas one
customer_reviews.author: KAREN BRANCIFORTE

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade if possible
customer_reviews.text: Chain was dull after 1 use and essentially just burns the wood now.
customer_reviews.author: robert j cave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great saw for cutting up felled trees. Mine was 18" diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Woody

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw, but I'm having a difficult time locating a replacement blade.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Monell

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Cut through my downed tree like a knife through butter...very quiet too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ez Princz

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect for cutting down to the ground a dozen 45 year old shrubs .
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: This proves "THE SIZE DOESN'T MATTER "
customer_reviews.text: The best acquisition if you have to work around the house (if you know how to use it)
customer_reviews.author: sebilata75

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband is very happy with this purchase. Lightweight and easily got the job done that it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.author: llbt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little electric chainsaw. Plenty of power, handles quite easy. I've been cutting some pretty large branches and trees with it and it's held up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: James Stultz

customer_reviews.title: The chainsaw has worked great so far
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw has worked great so far; I have cut down a few small trees 12-15 inch diameter with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This little chainsaw can cut down a small tree easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the homeowner. Wouldn't use it for huge trees, but for the average homeowner it is a very nice, lightweight alternative.
customer_reviews.author: auntiewendey

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and perfect for cutting up small limbs
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and perfect for cutting up small limbs, etc. I am a 62 yr. old woman and feel very safe using it!
customer_reviews.author: sueb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cut down my neighbors tree by mistake, he hee.....oh well.....at least I can see for miles now....ha ha ha!
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke after six branches were cut fixed it multiple times had to return.
customer_reviews.author: JROCK

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've used it three times and each time the chain comes off - I've tightened the chain but it still comes off. Would not buy again - disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Is great for what it is intended for.
customer_reviews.text: Is very good for the price point and for light home use. Would be five stars but it does not have a auto-kick break on the left hand guard. Being electric makes starting and stopping very easy. I used it on a big bush and had to pull stuff out of the way between cuts, because it is electric there is no problem running it for 45 second the putting it down for a minute then picking it back up.
customer_reviews.author: SesameStick

customer_reviews.title: Get a Mcculloch!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first and last B&D electric chain saw. Chain comes off bar frequently. I should have purchased another Mcculloch that last me for years!!
customer_reviews.author: GARY A ECKLER

customer_reviews.title: Blade sits to base.
customer_reviews.text: Qustion on assembly i noticed once the blade is attached it appears to point upwards a bit not completely streight out. Is this correct?. I lined up the the holes to the blade exactly how it fits to the base. Just want to mke sure.I turned it on and it works did not use it on any cutting yet.
customer_reviews.author: anthony fusaro

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: received and tries it out. cut better then my gas powered saw
customer_reviews.author: Misty

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Electric Chainsaw, 16-Inch, 12-Amp (CS1216)
product_meta.description: Style:Electric ChainsawThe Black & Decker CS1216 12amp 16 Corded Chainsaw features a 12 Amp motor for power with demanding cuts. It has a 16 low-kickback bar and chain for large cut capacities, along with tool-free chain tensioning for quick and easy adjustments. The automatic oiling system ensures constant bar and chain lubrication. It also has a clear window for ease of viewing oil level so you can monitor without running out. Backed by Black & Decker's 2 year limited warranty. Included Components: (1) Scabbard; Power Source: Corded
feature_bullets: 16 inch Low kickback bar and chain
Clear window for ease of viewing oil level

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars247 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
